message: http://interstateapp.com is my startup :) We provide businesses and developers alike a way to plan and share their development progress using roadmaps.
Just curious to see what some of the ideas people are applying with is
@simonify ... nice design
@undefined Can haz invite?
@alexpeake in our system your invite is mark as sent, you should have it in your inbox :)
http://www.munchonme.com
Startup from Estonia - http://www.pipedrive.com/. We are doing sales management system - it helps you close more deals.
http://tributeballoon.com - a web community in which people create personal tributes and raise awareness for public issues.
@awfy interstate looks great, i've also requested an invite! :)
@chingmei just sent you an invite :) hope you like the app!
@simonify thank you, our team loves trying out new task/project-management tools!
We are interviewing with MongoHQ...which offers hosted data for applications.

MongoHQ looked awesome last time I tried it out. We were going to use it originally at Interstate but didn't in the end for no apparent reason. I'm considering moving our database from in-house over to you guys.
@simonify Would be great...just let me know if you would like to talk about needs, what level would be best for you, etc.
We are interviewing with Taazr. It's a SaaS that detects bugs automatically in web applications. http://taazr.com

@jasonmccay we're currently hosted on MediaTemple so do you think the latency would be too much of an issue for us? We're considering moving to EC2 in a few months time though, so if/when we do, I'm sure it'll be likely that we'll also move to MongoHQ.
@unignorant awesome, looking forward to it & thanks!
@simonify thanks! we are still under development, but hopefully we'll have a beta up soon. interstate app looks great, by the way.
@unignorant sounds interesting, applied for an invite.

@jasonmccay Really glad that you guys are going the y-combinator round, Yours is a great service (and you will explode now that mongodb takes of). @simonify Doubt that there will be latency issues, we ran against mongo hq from a windows azure hosted site and some local machines and had no noticeable difference in performance.
@simonify As far as latency, we can test it out and see what happens. It should be pretty good.
@martin_sunset Thanks for the recommendation...we are excited for the opportunity to interview. It should be a great experience.
munch on me: I like that one a lot!

@jasonmccay we should chat to see if there's something we can work on together. our (http://www.akshell.com) users have been asking for mongo storage: http://groups.google.com/group/akshell/browse_thread/thread/4c2a43e341fdffb2
@jasonmccay we've just moved over to you guys. We'll try and see how bad/good the latency is and if it's acceptable we'll stay on MongoHQ :)
@simonify Sweet...let us know how we can help and what the results look like

@oleg Definitely. We have done a good bit of work with the Node.js community, so we would enjoy another JS opp. We have developed a REST API that includes the ability to provision/de-provision databases. Could work for you.
@simonify I just requested foe an invite..Would love to try it out
Anyone that went today want to offer a report about how the call went?
@jayshek cool thanks!  it'll be fun to meet up with you and others!

@jasonmccay Went well. Very low pressure. The call made it scarily clear how quickly "interview time" passes. We were able to do our product elevator speech, but we weren't really asked any "hard" questions. We interviewed with Alexis, by the way.
@unignorant Thanks for the insight...we are up this morning

Our interview with Alexis went good. It was kind of amusing that after Harj's email, we expected Alexis to ask us a bunch of questions and we didn't prepare any questions for him. So, we start and he is like "Ok guys, I am here for you. What questions do you have?" We took a moment to gather our wits and then were able to move forward.
Alexis was great. We really enjoyed having the opportunity to talk to him. Lots of good advice.
i thought the interviews were in person, what is the phone interview?

It was a preliminary conversation...to make sure that you had properly worked through your concept and to give you an opportunity to ask any questions that you may have had about YC before heading out there.
@chingmei nice to find out about your interest in project management tools -- have you tried Erbix Pluto? We'd love to get your feedback on it: http://www.erbix.com/pluto/ .

@jasonmccay that's funny, I had a pretty different experience with my interview with Harj - it felt like the real thing! He had hard questions about the team, product and customer acquisition, which I'm thankful for because it gives us a chance to iterate on better answers for the full interview
@vladd_rom nice, thanks, checking it out now...
@alabut Yeah, that was kind of what we were expecting to go through.
cool!
@ericflo that's a good point, thanks! I tried looking up attendees though and didn't see any YC alum though?
@ericflo well then there you go, thanks
@jasonmccay when do you guys land in the bay area? we can practice grilling each other and it'd be a good excuse to hang out anyway :)
@alabut I definitely recommend the grubwith.us dinners http://www.grubwith.us/groups/hacker-news
I know a lot of alums will be there
now that I think about it, that might be an interesting thing to propose on HN - a get together for the teams to practice interviewing
I don't know about the rest of you but it's been hard to corner YC alum from my area (email, productivity) to meet up and help prep
@ericflo speaking of - are you guys in the bay area and want to meet up? my cofounder gets in town on the 19th and we'd love to chat
(at least I think that was the plan)
I'll be at http://www.grubwith.us/restaurants/muguboka-san-francisco/meals/246 and http://www.grubwith.us/restaurants/miss-saigon-san-francisco/meals/250 would love to see you there :)
@alabut Each of those dinners has at 3 ore more alums.
I'm actually coding up our new landing page right now: http://alabut.com/projects/stacy/landing11.png
nice
thanks, here's a 2 min screencast if you want to learn more about what we're up to: youtu.be/-I8XVoEXMnc?hd=1
I actually met @leah for like two seconds back in 2009, when she came back to Cake Financial with a friend to pick up some old Pownce stuff from when they used to sublease there
@alabut That's exactly what I need. Badly...
@alabut We don't arrive until late Sunday evening, the 25th. Our interview is on Tuesday morning. Not sure when your interview is, but would love to meet on Monday.
@martin_sunset yeah? would you be willing to be a beta tester? we just started inviting people this weekend, if you want in: http://stacyplease.com

@jasonmccay ack, Monday's really bad for us because that's when our interview is, in the morning :) so it'd be too late to help us, but hopefully we can have time to help you instead - ping me at this username at gmail to connect, yeah?
@alabut Sweet...sent you an email.
Hi guys! Where are you staying in MV? We have our interviews on May 1st, would be great to hang out somewhere with other startups.. :) We will fly in on Thu 28th afternoon..
@alabut just added my email (martin@wa....). Convore really needs real time email updates on threads
@alabut Why u no respond 2 email. :)
Let me know where you meetup.  You can send an email to allan@ycreject.com
